channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Can Netflix’s stock hit $1,100? Wall Street’s biggest bull charts the path.
item.description: An analyst cheers the potential for more live programming — and perhaps a stock split next year.

item.title: Short-Covering Pushes U.S. Natural Gas Futures Higher
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures were up and on track to settle above the key $3 level amid forecasts of cold weather, which have prompted a short-covering bu...

item.title: U.S. Crude Oil Stockpiles Increase Amid Higher Imports
item.description: U.S. crude oil inventories rose last week as an increase in imports offset a decline in production, while refineries ran at a lower rate than the week...

item.title: Hungarian Forint Is Likely to Stay Weak Amid Risk Aversion
item.description: The Hungarian forint is likely to remain under pressure for some time due to risk aversion related to global uncertainties, ING analyst Frantisek Tabo...

item.title: Viking Therapeutics is more than just a weight-loss stock, and that’s drawing cheers
item.description: The biotech’s liver-disease treatment is also viewed as best-in-class, earning it a full slate of buy ratings from analysts.

item.title: ‘My house is paid off’: How do I ensure my son-in-law never gets my money — even if my daughter dies before he does?
item.description: “I would like it to go to only my daughter and grandchildren.”

item.title: Amazon is beating other retailers on price, but here’s how you can beat Amazon
item.description: Bargain hunters are taking advantage of rebate platforms to bring costs down.

item.title: Walmart and Target: A Tale of Two Retailers
item.description: Is Walmart a bellwether for other retailers or the Grinch that will steal Christmas from everyone else?

item.title: Dow Edges Up as Nvidia Earnings Loom
item.description: The Nasdaq Composite and S&P 500 edged lower while the Dow industrials were roughly flat.

item.title: Target CEO says ‘consumers continue to spend cautiously’ amid triple-miss earnings report
item.description: Target’s stock is set to suffer worst day in more than two years after profit, revenue, comparable sales and outlook all came in below expectations.
